universum.studios.android.intent

Class ContentIntent<I extends ContentIntent<I>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • universum.studios.android.intent.BaseIntent<I>
      • universum.studios.android.intent.ContentIntent<I>
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ImageIntent, VideoIntent

    public abstract class ContentIntent<I extends ContentIntent<I>>
extends BaseIntent<I>
    A BaseIntent builder implementation providing base API for building and starting of intents targeting a content previewing/editing/obtaining related applications.

    The content intent may be intent to obtain or preview specific type of content, like image, audio, video, .... To decide which type of intent (obtain/preview) should be started, the current set of ContentIntent.ContentHandler is checked, if it isn't empty an OBTAIN intent will be started, so chooser dialog will be showed with a list items specific for each of current providers. If there are no providers assigned to this intent builder and there was specified valid Uri to input(Uri), a PREVIEW intent will be started.

    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    Martin Albedinsky

      A ContentHandler is a simple class that may be used to add one item into ContentIntent builder.

        Parameters:
        fileName - The desired name for the requested file.
        externalDirectoryType - One of Environment.DIRECTORY_PICTURES, Environment.DIRECTORY_MOVIES, ..., external directory types.

        Parameters:
        fileName - The desired name for the requested file. Must also contain a suffix for the file.
        directory - The directory within which should be the requested file created.
        Returns:
        New instance of the desired file or null if some IO error occurs during its creation process.

                      List<ContentIntent.ContentHandler> handlers)

        Returns:
        This intent builder to allow methods chaining.

      • withHandler

        public I withHandler(@NonNull
                     ContentIntent.ContentHandler handler)
        Adds the specified content handler item into the list of handlers. These handler items will be used to build a chooser dialog with list of these items (if any) so a user may choose one of them to handle a specific content intent. Such dialog is created and showed whenever content intent is started via startWith(IntentStarter) and there is at least one handler item.
        Parameters:
        handler - The desired handler item to add.
        Returns:
        This intent builder to allow methods chaining.
        See Also:
        withHandlers(ContentHandler...), withDefaultHandlers(Context), handlers()

      • handlers

        @NonNull
public List<ContentIntent.ContentHandler> handlers()
        Returns the list of content handlers to be displayed in a chooser dialog.
        Returns:
        List of handlers or Collections.EMPTY_LIST if no content handlers has been added yet.
        See Also:
        withHandler(ContentHandler), withHandlers(List), withDefaultHandlers(Context)

      • input

        public I input(@Nullable
               File file)
        Same as input(Uri) with uri created from the given file if not null.
        Parameters:
        file - The desired file to be used to crate input Uri. May be null to clear the current input uri.

      • input

        public I input(@Nullable
               android.net.Uri uri)
        Sets an Uri to a content that should be previewed by an activity that can handle/preview the content of the data type specified via dataType(String). The specified Uri will be attached to an intent build via build(Context) if there are no content handlers attached to this intent builder.

        Note, that the current data type will be set to null, so dataType(String) should be called immediately after a new Uri is set. A specific implementations of this ContentIntent builder may here specify a default data type.

        Parameters:
        uri - The desired uri, which should be delivered to the handling activity. May be null to clear the current one.
        Returns:
        This intent builder to allow methods chaining.
        See Also:
        uri()

      • output

        public I output(@Nullable
                File file)
        Same as output(Uri) with uri created from the given file if not null.
        Parameters:
        file - The desired file to be used to crate Uri. May be null to clear the current output uri.

      • output

        public I output(@Nullable
                android.net.Uri uri)
        Sets an Uri where should be stored a content provided by an activity that can handle/provide the content of the data type specified via dataType(String). The specified Uri will be attached to an intent of one of content handlers attached to this intent builder.
        Parameters:
        uri - The desired uri. May be null to clear the current one.
        Returns:
        This intent builder to allow methods chaining.
        See Also:
        uri()

      • uri

public android.net.Uri uri()

        Returns:
        Current uri or null if there was no uri specified yet.

      • ensureCanBuildOrThrow

        protected void ensureCanBuildOrThrow()
        Description copied from class: BaseIntent
        Called to ensure that this builder can build its Intent from its current data.

        If there are some required data missing/not specified, an exception indicating such state should be thrown. The default exception may be created via BaseIntent.cannotBuildIntentException(String).

        Overrides:
        ensureCanBuildOrThrow in class BaseIntent<I extends ContentIntent<I>>

      • onStartWith

        protected boolean onStartWith(@NonNull
                              IntentStarter starter,
                              @NonNull
                              android.content.Intent intent)
        Description copied from class: BaseIntent
        Invoked whenever BaseIntent.startWith(IntentStarter) is called and there is an activity available that can handle the given intent that has been created via BaseIntent.build(Context).

        This implementation always returns true.

        Overrides:
        onStartWith in class BaseIntent<I extends ContentIntent<I>>
        Parameters:
        starter - The starter with which to start the intent.
        intent - The intent instance created by this intent builder.
        Returns:
        True to indicate that the intent has been started, false otherwise.
